commit.message: Add _epoch_id to ShenandoahAllocator to trace the update of shared alloc regions

1. Allow to reserve alloc region with free space >= PLAB::min_size()
2. Other minor fixes
Merge branch 'cas-alloc-1' of https://github.com/pengxiaolong/jdk into cas-alloc-1
Avoid AtomicAccess::load in attempt_allocation_in_alloc_regions when called from attempt_allocation_slow
No need to use Atomic::load to read shared alloc region in release_alloc_regions
No need to use Atomic::load to read shared alloc region in refresh_alloc_regions
Only use atomic allocation when allocate from shared alloc regions
Fix build error after merging from tip
Some comments updates as suggested in PR review
Declare ShenandoahFreeSetPartitionId as enum instead of enum class
Remove unnecessary `enum class ShenandoahFreeSetPartitionId : uint8_t` in shenandoahAllocator.php
Make ShenandoahAllocator as template class to make compiled code more efficient for each alloc partition
Remove unnecessary change and tidy up
Use template for in the impl of reserve_alloc_regions and find_heap_region_for_allocation
Not try steal region from mutator in reserve_alloc_regions
Check if partition is empty before diving into find_heap_region_for_allocation_internal
For Mutator only reserve regions as active alloc region if the free space is >= PLAB::max_size()
Set default value of ShenandoahMutatorAllocRegions to 8
Unset active_alloc_region flag when the region is out of space
Remove use of load_acquire and release_store
Rewrite attempt_allocation_in_alloc_regions and avoid using AtomicAccess::load_acquire
Rename fields of struct ShenandoahAllocRegion to remove prefix `_`
Reserve alloc regions before the clients(mutator/collector) needs to use them
defer accounting recomputation is not handled properly (plus some code formating)
offset-by-one issue in new impl of reserve_alloc_regions_internal
Update recompute total used and total affiliated more often
Always reserve affiliated regions first for collector allocator
Comment out sanity check in recompute_total_affiliated
Fix build error in some build variants
Try to satisfy alloc req before install alloc region
Move inline function definition to hpp file
increase region counts of partition when unretire a region
Fix corner cases in which heap accountings are not updated.
Attempt to fix assert "Cannot remove more regions than are present"
Move all the old alloc logic in ShenandoahHeap to ShenandoahOldCollectorAllocator
Release all release_alloc_regions even before ShenandoahVerify in ShenandoahOldGC::op_final_mark
Reorder slow-path to solve unexpected crash
Add debug log for alloc result
Ensure all alloc regions are released before choose cset/rebuild free-set
Use cmpxchg to update to watermark because we may update it concurrently from multiple threads after allocations
Exclude regions if affiliation doesn't match
Reserve region a alloc region if capacity >= PLAB::min_size
ShenandoahOldCollectorAllocator should not take heap lock, but assert heap locked.
1. Always use AtomicAccess::load; 2. ShenandoahOldCollectorAllocator always delegate to  _free_set->allocate_for_collector
Move two internal methods of ShenandoahFreeSet to private
_ready_for_retire of ShenandoahHeapRegionReadyForRetireChecker should be a ref
Fix valid logic checking if a region is ready for retire after atomic allocation
Only try to reserve alloc regions when there is at least one refreshable alloc region
Revert the changes to use ShenandoahOldCollectorAllocator, not ready yet
Always use snapshot of top when cacluclate aligned size for lab alloc
Fix alignment issue with plab alloc
Use ShenandoahOldCollectorAllocator for old collector allocation
Release collector alloc regions at final-mark
Use ShenandoahCollectorAllocator for collector alloc request in young gen
Refactor atomic alloction for mutator and make the impl easy to extend to collector
Renaming directly allocatable region to alloc region
Remove ShenandoahDirectlyAllocatableRegionAffinity and simply use thread local instead
Remove unnecessary test for directly allocable region
Merge branch 'cas-alloc-1' of https://github.com/pengxiaolong/jdk into cas-alloc-1
Set region back to empty and unaffiliated when release a directly allocatable region(may happen in full GC)
Address test failures after merging the change from master which unify the accounting in FreeSet and ShenandoahGeneration
Fix errors caused by renaming ofAtomic to AtomicAccess
Merge branch 'cas-alloc-1' of https://github.com/pengxiaolong/jdk into cas-alloc-1
SpinPause instead of naked_yield if it is MP system
Ensure no mutator is allocating in the region when release it directly allocatable regions
Not eagerly steal allocate memory from directly allocatable regions
Update start index to next region which has enough space
Remove some of the code in try_allocate_single_for_mutator which complicates the logic
Retire region if remaining memory is less than PLAB:min_size_bytes()
Not use retire_region_from_partition when allocate directly allocatable regions and more accurate used/available metrics
Fix test failures caused by new alloc type _alloc_cds
Not use Atomic::load in the CAS allocation code to read shared directly allocatable regions
Don't count reserved region w/o alloc as free
Don't eagerly steal allocate when GC state is not stable
retire_region_from_partition from mutator view when reserve it for direct allocation
Don't eagerly steal allocate when GC state is not stable
Count the region free space as used when reserve it for direct allocation
Always call make_regular_allocation after successful allocation to reset_age
retire region from partition when free is less than PLAB::min_size_bytes

1. Add PLAB::min_size_bytes()
2. Reserve a region for direct alloc when it has more than ShenandoahHeapRegion::max_tlab_size_bytes free space
Only call try_recycle_under_lock when region is empty or trash
Rename method names to avoid confusions
Not always check all direct allocation regions when CAS fails
Check all direct allocatable regions when refill
Assert before reserve directly allocatable region
retire region from mutator partition more aggressively
Always release shared region if it doesn't have enough space for the allocation req
Retire if a region has less than PLAB::min_size() free space
Use PaddedArray to store directly allocatable regions
Use random to decide the start index where mutator starts allocating with CAS
Add CPU afinity support and use CPU process id instead thread id for CAS allocation
Fix improper order when release a region from direct allocation
Fix improper order when release a region from direct allocation
Fix improper order when release a region from direct allocation
Not repeat allocation on the regions already tried before stealing alloc from other shared regions
Allocate new obj before storing the new reserved shared region
reserve region when non-empty region has enough capacity
Only reserve empty region for direct allocation, also take the chance to allocate object under lock from the non-empty region with enough capacity
Not reserve a region if it is ready for promotion
Use current thread id for hash
Steal alloc from other shared regions

Revert "Duplicate Z's CPUAffinity in gc shared"

This reverts commit 66f3919d1b4c31945718494c0ec9d8b960158a2c.
Remove use of heap lock when update used
increase_used needs to be called with heap lock
Humongous allocation and GC shall not use regions reserved for direct allocation
Duplicate Z's CPUAffinity in gc shared
Add allocate_atomic using CAS to ShenandoahHeapRegion
